4005-710: Programming Language Theory Q20093: 4003-243: Object-Oriented Programming in Java Q20092: 4003-233: Computer Science 3 Q20091: 4003-450/4003-709: Programming Language Concepts University of Chicago Winter 2009: CMSC 22610: Implementation of Computer Languages-1 Cornell University Spring 2003: CS486: Applied Logic (teaching assistant) Fall 2000: CS611: Advanced Programming Languages (teaching assistant) …less… Research My main research interests lie with programming languages, including compiler technology, parallelism and concurrency, type systems, and program semantics. Curriculum Vitae Publications (fluetbib.bib) Type- and Control-Flow Analysis MLton: whole-program, optimizing Standard ML compiler MaPLe (MPL): a functional language for provably efficient and safe multicore parallelism (joint project with Sam Westrick, Mike Rainey, Umut Acar) …more… Manticore: a Heterogeneous-Parallel Functional Programming Language (joint project with Sven Auhagen, Lars Bergstrom, Mike Rainey, John Reppy, Adam Shaw) Fairness for Transactional Events (joint work with Edward Amsden) Compiling Self-Adjusting Programs with Continuations (joint work with Ruy Ley-Wild and Umut Acar) Monadic and Substructural Type Systems for Region-Based Memory Management (PhD thesis) Transactional Events (joint work with Kevin Donnelly) Linear Regions Are All You Need (joint work with Greg Morrisett and Amal Ahmed) Practical Datatype Specializations (joint work with Riccardo Pucella) A Step-Indexed Model of Substructural State (joint work with Amal Ahmed and Greg Morrisett) L3: A Language with Linear Locations (joint work with Amal Ahmed and Greg Morrisett) Monadic Regions (joint work with Greg Morrisett) A Safe Runtime System in Cyclone (joint work with Dan Wang) Computational Content of Boolean Valuations (joint work with Stuart Allen and Bob Constable) Phantom Types and Subtyping (joint work with Riccardo Pucella) Contification Using Dominators (joint work with Stephen Weeks) …less… Professional Activities The 2024 ACM SIGPLAN ML Family Workshop (ML'24) — Program Committee September 6, 2024;
